newsitem.title: USA: Woolworth to sell German specialty chain.
newsitem.headline: Woolworth to sell German specialty chain.

text.p: Woolworth Corp said on Thursday that it has decided to sell its German 41-store costume jewelry and accessory chain, Rubin GmbH, to Bijou Brigitte modische Accessoires AG.
The sale is to take place on November 1, it said. Terms were not disclosed.
Rubin is a subsidiary of Retail Co of Germany Inc, a wholly owned subsidiary of Woolworth.
Woolworth Chairman and Chief Executive Roger Farah said that the sale is part of the company's efforts to improve its German operations by focusing on general merchandise.
It previously announced the sale of two other German speciality businesses: Lady Plus and New Yorker Sd, in which it had a 50 percent stake.
